snippet: The crush outside Saudi Arabia’s holy city of Mecca killed at least 1,470 people during the hajj last month, The Associated Press said.
abstract: Associated Press reports September stampede near Mecca claimed lives of 1,470 people, count that is 701 people higher than Saudi Arabia's official tally, making it deadliest event to ever strike annual Islamic pilgrimage.
lead_paragraph: The crush outside Saudi Arabia’s holy city of Mecca killed at least 1,470 people during the hajj last month, The Associated Press said.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia: News Agency Compiles New Tally for Stampede’s Death Toll
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Saudi Arabia: News Agency Compiles New Tally for Stampede’s Death Toll
